questions.question: When would VDF be used for a position fix?
options: (a) When an aircraft declares an emergency on any frequency
(b) When first talking to an FIR on crossing an international boundary
(c) When joining controlled airspace from uncontrolled airspace
(d) When declaring an emergency on 121.500 MHz
questions.solution: (a) When an aircraft declares an emergency on any frequency

questions.question: What equipment does an aircraft need when carrying out a VDF let-down?

(b) No special equipment required in the aircraft or on the ground
(c) Only a VHF radio is needed in the aircraft
(d) It is pilot interpreted, so ATC is not required
questions.solution: (a) No equipment required in the aircraft

(d) It uses line of sight propagation
questions.solution: (a) It is simple and only requires a VHF radio on the ground

questions.question: When is coastal error at its worst for an aircraft at low level?

(c) Beacon close to the coast at an acute angle to the coast
(d) Beacon close to the coast at 90° to the coast
questions.solution: (a) Beacon inland at an acute angle to the coast

questions.question: What happens when a DME in the search mode fails to achieve lock-on?

(d) It alternates between search and memory modes every 10 seconds
questions.solution: (a) It  stays  in  the  search  mode,  but  reduces  to  60  pulse  pairs  per  second  (ppps)

questions.question: Concerning NAVSTAR/GPS orbits, which of the following statements is correct?
options: (a) The inclination of the orbits is 55° with an orbital period of 12 hours
(b) The inclination of the orbits is 55° with an orbital period of 24 hours
(c) The orbits are geostationary to provide global coverage
(d) The orbits are inclined at 65° with an orbital period of 11 hours 15 minutes
questions.solution: (a) The inclination of the orbits is 55° with an orbital period of 12 hours

questions.question: NAVSTAR GPS receiver clock error is removed by:
options: (a) regular auto-synchronization with the satellite clocks
(b) adjusting the pseudo-ranges to determine the error
(c) synchronization with the satellite clocks on initialization
(d) having an appropriate atomic time standard within the receiver
questions.solution: (a) regular auto-synchronization with the satellite clocks

questions.question: The  contents  of  the  navigation  and  systems  message  from  NAVSTAR/GPS  SVs
options: (a) satellite clock error, almanac data, ionospheric propagation information

questions.solution: (a) satellite clock error, almanac data, ionospheric propagation information

(d) By using the ETA at the destination
questions.solution: (a) By using the ATD at the previous waypoint

questions.question: Which  of  the  following  can  be  input  manually  to  the  FMC  using  a  maximum  of  5

questions.solution: (a) Waypoints, latitude and longitude, SIDs and STARs

questions.solution: (a) Causes false bearings as the goniometer locks onto the sky wave

(c) sends information for receiver to determine latitude, longitude and time

questions.question: In a RNAV system the DME is tuned:

questions.question: In NAVSTAR/GPS range measurement is achieved by measuring:
options: (a) the time difference between the minimum number of satellites

(c) the synchronization of the satellite and receiver clocks
(d) the time taken for a signal to travel from the receiver to the satellite and return
questions.solution: (a) the time difference between the minimum number of satellites

questions.question: Quadrantal error in the ADF is caused by:

(c) the electrical wiring running through the aircraft
questions.solution: (a) the metallic structure of the aircraft
